lines.content: This project is a Studio-Ghibli Themed Task Manager that helps you to manage your todos, deadlines and events.
- [x] Add 3 types of Tasks: ToDo, Deadline and Event
- [x] Show notes added to a task
- [x] Search for certain tasks based on key words
- [x] Storing of tasks for easy access in next use
- [x] Search for certain tasks based on key words
- [x] Storing of tasks for easy access in next use
A ToDo is a task with a task name.
todo buy gift for my bestie
A Deadline is a task that has a end date and time.
[D][ ] book venue for party (by: Feb. 14 2022 09:20 pm)
An Event is a task that has a start date and time as well as a end date and time.
*Command: event TASK_NAME /at YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm /to YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm*
[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
A Deadline is a task that has a end date and time.
[D][ ] book venue for party (by: Feb. 14 2022 09:20 pm)
An Event is a task that has a start date and time as well as a end date and time.
*Command: event TASK_NAME /at YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm /to YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm*
[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
Use command ```list``` to see all tasks you have added.
2.[D][ ] book venue for party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
3.[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
Use command ```mark``` to mark a task as done. Task number of 1 refers to first task in the list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done: [T][X] buy gift for my bestie
Use command ```unmark``` to unmark a task to change its status back to undone.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: [T][] buy gift for my bestie
*Command: add note to task TASK_NUMBER NOTE_MESSAGE*
add note to task 1 maybe a plant would be good?
Got it, I've added a note to task [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Use 'show note from <taskNumber>' to see the note
Note 1: maybe a plant would be good?
*Command: edit note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER NEW_NOTE_MESSAGE*
edit note 1 from task 1 maybe a cactus would be good?
Got it! I've edited the note from [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Example of task list after edit note:
Note 1: maybe a cactus would be good?
Deletes a note from a task.
*Command: clear note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER*
Got it! I've deleted the note from [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Example of task list after clear note:
Got it, I've deleted the task!
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
Example of task list after command:
1.[D][ ] book venue for party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
2.[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
Every change in each task is recorded in a file called duke.txt. When the programme is run again, previous task lists will be available for viewing and use.
2.[D][ ] book venue for party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
3.[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
Use command ```mark``` to mark a task as done. Task number of 1 refers to first task in the list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done: [T][X] buy gift for my bestie
Use command ```unmark``` to unmark a task to change its status back to undone.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: [T][] buy gift for my bestie
*Command: add note to task TASK_NUMBER NOTE_MESSAGE*
add note to task 1 maybe a plant would be good?
Got it, I've added a note to task [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Use 'show note from <taskNumber>' to see the note
Note 1: maybe a plant would be good?
*Command: edit note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER NEW_NOTE_MESSAGE*
edit note 1 from task 1 maybe a cactus would be good?
Got it! I've edited the note from [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Example of task list after edit note:
Note 1: maybe a cactus would be good?
Deletes a note from a task.
*Command: clear note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER*
Got it! I've deleted the note from [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Example of task list after clear note:
Got it, I've deleted the task!
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
Example of task list after command:
1.[D][ ] book venue for party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
2.[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
Every change in each task is recorded in a file called duke.txt. When the programme is run again, previous task lists will be available for viewing and use.
No Face is a Studio Ghibli themed task manager for all Ghibli fans out there!
[Image of Spirited Away background used in Programme](https://wallpaperaccess.com/spirited-away-ipad)

- [Olivia Johansen](https://github.com/oliviajohansen/ip) and [Caitlin Jee](https://github.com/caitlinjee/ip/tree/master/src/main/resources/view) to understand how to improve the GUI of No Face, particularly in achieving the shape and colour of the dialog boxes as well as shape of photo
- [Dominic Lim](https://github.com/domlimm/ip) for understanding how to use relative path for updating of database
This project is a Studio-Ghibli Themed Task Manager that helps you to manage your todos, deadlines and events.
1. Ensure that you have Java 11 or above installed.
1. Down the latest version of `Duke` from [here](http://link.to/duke).
- [x] Add 3 types of Tasks: ToDo, Deadline and Event
- [x] Show notes added to a task
- [x] Search for certain tasks based on key words
- [x] Storing of tasks for easy access in next use
A ToDo is a task with a task name.
todo buy gift for my bestie
A Deadline is a task that has a end date and time.
[D][ ] book venue for party (by: Feb. 14 2022 09:20 pm)
An Event is a task that has a start date and time as well as a end date and time.
*Command: event TASK_NAME /at YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm /to YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm*
[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
Use command ```list``` to see all tasks you have added.
2.[D][ ] book venue for party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
3.[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
Use command ```mark``` to mark a task as done. Task number of 1 refers to first task in the list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done: [T][X] buy gift for my bestie
Use command ```unmark``` to unmark a task to change its status back to undone.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: [T][] buy gift for my bestie
*Command: add note to task TASK_NUMBER NOTE_MESSAGE*
add note to task 1 maybe a plant would be good?
Got it, I've added a note to task [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Use 'show note from <taskNumber>' to see the note
Note 1: maybe a plant would be good?
*Command: edit note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER NEW_NOTE_MESSAGE*
edit note 1 from task 1 maybe a cactus would be good?
Got it! I've edited the note from [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Example of task list after edit note:
Note 1: maybe a cactus would be good?
Deletes a note from a task.
*Command: clear note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER*
Got it! I've deleted the note from [T][] buy gift for my bestie
Example of task list after clear note:
Got it, I've deleted the task!
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
Example of task list after command:
1.[D][ ] book venue for party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
2.[E][ ] birthday party (at: Feb. 28 2022 07:15 pm to Feb. 28 2022 10:15 pm)
Every change in each task is recorded in a file called duke.txt. When the programme is run again, previous task lists will be available for viewing and use.
| todo TASK_NAME | adds a todo with specified task name |
| deadline TASK_NAME /by YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm | adds a deadline to the task list |
| event TASK_NAME /at YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm /to YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm | adds a event to the task list |
| mark TASK_NUMBER | marks specified task as done |
| find KEY_WORD | returns only tasks that have the keyword |
| delete TASK_NUMBER | deletes specified task from list |
| add note to task TASK_NUMBER NOTE_MESSAGE | adds a note to specified task |
| show note from task TASK_NUMBER| shows notes that have been added to specified task |
| edit note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER NEW_NOTE_MESSAGE | edits a note from specified task |
| delete note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER | deletes a note from specified task |
* Functions as the chatbot by taking in inputs.
* Also helps in giving out specified outputs.
* Returns a response to the user based on user input.
* @return a string response to be shown to user
Command c = parser.parse(input); //read the full command and return the command
* Handles commands from users in String and filters the information needed to create {@link Command}.
* Creates a Parser, which processes command inputs from users, given in String.
*Parses string commands from user into information needed to execute the command.
* @param command which is a string input by the user with a command keyword.
* @return {@link Command } which starts the execution of the command
* @throws DukeException if an unknown command keyword or incomplete command is given
* Parses a command that seeks to mark a task.
* @param command is a string with a command keyword "mark" from user
* @return the index of the {@link Task} to mark in {@link seedu.duke.task.TaskList}
* @throws DukeException if an invalid task number is given from user
//command is given as "mark 5" so index 5 is where "5" is at
//-1 because index in taskList is 0 based but command uses 1-based index
* Parses a command that seeks to unmark a task.
* @param command is a string with a command keyword "unmark" from user
* @return the index of the {@link Task} to unmark in {@link seedu.duke.task.TaskList}
* @throws DukeException if an invalid task number is given from user
//command is given as "unmark 5" so index 7 is where the task index to parse, "5" is at
* Parses a command that seeks to delete a task.
* @param command is a string with a command keyword "delete" from user
* @return the index of the {@link Task} to delete in {@link seedu.duke.task.TaskList}
* @throws DukeException if an invalid task number is given from user
//command is given as "delete <task number>" so task number is at index 7
* Parses a command that seeks to add a ToDo o to {@link seedu.duke.task.TaskList}.
* @param command is a string with a command keyword "todo"
* @throws DukeException if an incomplete command is given from user
//command is given as "todo <taskName>" so task name starts at index 5

* @return {@link LocalDateTime} object to create {@link Deadline} and {@link Event}
* @throws DukeException if wrongly formatted date or no date is given from user.
throw new DukeException("Unable to get date properly :(");

* @throws DukeException if date cannot be obtained
* Parses a command that seeks to search a {@link Task} in {@link TaskList}.
* @param command is a string like "search book" to find tasks with the word book in it
* @return String Keyword to search in {@link seedu.duke.task.TaskList}
int indexToStart = 5; //command is given as "find <keyword>", the keyword starts at index 5
* Parses a command that seeks to add a note to a Task.
* @param command is a string like "add note to task TASK_NUMBER NOTE_CONTENT"
* @return a string that contains the NOTE_CONTENT
* @throws DukeException if NOTE_CONTENT cannot be retrieved
//command is given as "add note to task <task number> <note content>"
* Parses a command that seeks to add a note to a Task by finding the index of task to add to.
* @param command is a string like "add note to task TASK_NUMBER NOTE_CONTENT"
* @return a int that contains the index of the Task to add the note to
* @throws DukeException if index cannot be retrieved
throw new DukeException("Problem with getting index to add note to");

//command is given as "show note from task <task number>"

* @param command is a string like "clear note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER"
* @return a int that contains the index of the note to delete from the Note List
* @throws DukeException if index cannot be retrieved
throw new DukeException("Can't seem to get the task index to delete note");

* @param command is a string like "clear note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER"
* @return a int that contains the index of the task to delete the note from

//command is given as "clear note <notenumber> from task <taskNumber>"
throw new DukeException("Can't seem to get the note index to delete note");
* Parses a command that seeks to edit a note from a task.
* @param command is a string like "edit note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER"
* @return a int that contains the index of the note to edit from the Note List
* @throws DukeException if index cannot be retrieved
//command is given as "edit note <notenumber> from task <tasknumber> <noteContent>"
throw new DukeException("Can't seem to get the task index to edit note");
* Parses a command that seeks to edit a note from a task.
* @param command is a string like "edit note NOTE_NUMBER from task TASK_NUMBER"
* @return a int that contains the index of the task to edit from the task list
* @throws DukeException if index cannot be retrieved
//command is given as "edit note <notenumber> from task <tasknumber> <noteContent>"
throw new DukeException("Can't seem to get the note index to edit note");

//command is given as "edit note <notenumber> from task <tasknumber> <noteContent>"

* Handles updating of database, a txt file, whenever {@link TaskList} is updated.
* Creates a Storage object which is used to update the database as commands are executed.
* @param filePath specifying the path to the database
* @param fileName specifying the name of the file
assert filePath.length() > 0 : "Storage Constructor - filePath cannot be null";
assert fileName.length() > 0 : "Storage Constructor - fileName cannot be null";

* Creates a Deadline object from information in database.

String taskDetails, String taskName, boolean doneStatus, NoteList noteList) throws DukeException {
return new Deadline(taskName, doneStatus, endDate, noteList);
* Creates a Event object from information in database.

String taskDetails, String taskName, boolean doneStatus, NoteList noteList) throws DukeException {
return new Event(taskName, doneStatus, endDate, startDate, noteList);

* Creates a NoDateException() with a message telling user to add a valid date.
